intro: Petrocosmea deltoidfolia, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a species of flowering plant in the Orchidaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of China, Vietnam, and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with lance-shaped leaves and showy, violet or purple flowers. It thrives in rocky or well-drained soil and requires a cool, humid environment. Petrocosmea deltoidfolia is often found in shaded, forested areas at high altitudes.
